title: Add 'git st' as a shortcut for 'git status'. Add to dockerfile
Stop configuring using env vars, and remove env vars from the compiler

comments.author: Paul Biggar
comments.text: Removed ENABLE_VERIFICATION_TESTS usage; verification now driven by --verification flag in TestRunner and run-verification-tests. Updated verification e2e docs and added ScriptHelper tests. Tests: ./run-tests --filter='Script Helper Tests', ./run-tests --no-build. Benchmarks: ./benchmarks/run_benchmarks.sh sum_to_n.

title: Cleanup tests to use stdout much less
description: A lot of the tests have their expected value as something like . However, the test suites nearly supports a simpler version: . The difference is the newline. I'd like to allow the test definition so that we can write  instead of the longer stdout-based test definition. Change the test parser to allow newline by default, then change all the tests to use the shorter, cleaner test definition

title: Some tests say that you can't use TCO with them, and have TCO disabled. Verify if that's true and if not, update the tests to remove that requirement, and the related documentation
Install into the dockerfule, the latest version of the darklang interpreter, available on github via darklang/dark. Call the executable darklang-interpreter
Add a nicer bash prompt in the docker container, adding it to the dockerfile
allow 'git ci' and 'git co' as shortcuts; update the dockerfile to include support
Move tasks from plan file into beads
description: Check the git log to see if it was already completed, then add remaining tasks to bd. Remove the plan file when finished

title: Add a nicer bash prompt in the docker container, adding it to the dockerfile
Uncomment working tests
description: There are hundreds of commented tests in .e2e files, many of which probably work. Uncomment any working tests. When finished methodically work through non-working tests and fix them

title: Stop copying tests to build directory
description: The compiler seems to be set up such that the tests run from the build directory, and we need to compile the code in order to copy the tests to the build directory. Instead, run the tests using the source directory, and stop copying them into the build diretory

title: Cleanup tests to use stdout much less
description: A lot of the tests have their expected value as something like `= stdout="5.50\n"`. However, the test suites nearly supports a simpler version: `= 5.50`. The difference is the newline. I'd like to allow the test definition so that we can write `= 5.50` instead of the longer stdout-based test definition. Change the test parser to allow newline by default, then change all the tests to use the shorter, cleaner test definition

comments.author: Paul Biggar
comments.text: Updated test DSL parsing to support bare stdout + converted tests to simple form; tests now pass. Benchmark run fails on mandelbrot validation and quicksort build (Undefined variable: pivot), so benchmarks not clean yet.

title: When we run benchmarks, they break on a certain step (in quicksort). The script should continue running in this case, and simply record that the benchmark we couldn't build/run is broken
Use python3 as scripting
description: Tell AGENTS.md to use python3 if scripting is needed

title: Evaluate potential F# warning/error flags to enable, that will make the codebase better. Add recommendations to file
Install htop and bd via the dockerfile
In the benchmarks/CURRENT-STATUS.md, there are claims about various benchmarks failing in certain situations. Validate if that's true and update the documentation if not
